title: Healthy Genital Skin Care

content: The world’s skin care obsession has reached its peak. Anything you need, it is likely you can find it. Genital skin care is no exception. Falling under the category of feminine hygiene and sexual well-being, this beauty sector is worth over $30 billion and is projected to grow to $40 billion by 2025. Rightfully so, new products and emerging treatments are vast and there is a feeling of FOMO trying to keep up with the latest craze. The popularity of services catering to vulvar health has increased, and more at-home options are available, too. I wanted to delve into the world of vulvar skin care and guide you through safe and helpful options to try.
Feminine Care Products

The genital skin is the thinnest layer of skin on the body. Transepidermal water loss is high on the labial and scrotal skin, making the potential for irritation high. People have become very conscious about choosing products, opting for fragrance-free products, hormones, and parabens, and avoiding forever chemicals.

content: There are many products on the market geared toward vaginal health and pH balance. The vagina has the ability to self-clean, so products aimed at pH balance are unnecessary. Second to a washcloth and water, washes containing glycerin act as a humectant, which draws water into the skin. This is a gentle way to cleanse the skin while avoiding irritation. Ingrown hairs are also a major complaint. This is a common occurrence following shaving, waxing, or cutting the hair too close to the skin. As the hair regrows, it can curl back into the skin and cause ingrown hair. Grooming is the cause of this condition, which is why it can recur. More permanent hair removal/reduction options should be considered to address the root cause. However, this may mean you’ll have to make a big time and financial commitment.

content: If you’re not ready for the hearty price tag of electrolysis or laser hair removal, manual hair removal remains the most cost-effective option for grooming.
Topical Hair Removal Products

Depilatories remove hair at the skin’s surface. Depilatories contain thioglycolic or thiolactic acids, which disrupt the disulfide bond within hair follicles and make them easy to wipe away. They can remove hair anywhere on the skin, and there are formulations specifically designed for sensitive areas, like the face or groin. This chemical process can also be irritating to your skin and has been known to cause burns and abrasions when left on your skin for too long. I recommend performing a test spot and waiting 24 hours to ensure no adverse reactions
Folliculitis Treatment
Some of the above grooming techniques can cause folliculitis, or skin irritation, which can be treated and controlled with products. I recommend:

My all-time favorite product for reducing and treating ingrown hairs is PFB Vanish roll-on gel. The product contains salicylic, glycolic, and lactic acids, which gently exfoliate the skin to treat and prevent ingrown hairs. This product can be applied daily.
bullets: Using an oil- or cream-based moisturizer daily

content: Exfoliation is a great tool to address many concerns in groin hyperpigmentation, ingrown hairs, and dull skin. Either chemical or manual exfoliants are a great option to remove dead skin. I recommend at least weekly exfoliation of the outer genital skin.
What Is a Vajacial?

“Vajacial” – also known as a Brazilian facial – is a clever term coined for bikini-focused “facials.” It is one of the latest crazes to capture beauty culture. Many social media influencers and regular users alike have documented their experiences and honest reviews. For most, it is a resounding yes and typically provides soothing post-wax treatment, while also focusing on treating ingrown hairs and discoloration.

Typically following a Brazilian wax, this treatment focuses on the mons pubis, inguinal folds, and the outer labia skin. The steps are similar to a traditional facial. Following a wax, a stream treatment begins the service to open the pores, then ingrown hairs are removed. An exfoliant is applied, either chemically (e.g., chemical peel) or manually exfoliated with a sugar or salt scrub. A calming mask is applied, and the treatment finishes with a moisturizer or oil. A vajacial can focus on several concerns, including hyperpigmentation, ingrown hairs, and post-waxing irritation.
bullets: First Aid Beauty KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub with 10% AHA
The INKEY List Glycolic Acid Exfoliating Body Stick
Isle of Paradise Confidently Clear Body Polish Scrub with Glycolic and Hyaluronic Acids
